news.title: Technology to improve rockfall analysis on cliffs could save money, lives
news.summary: CORVALLIS, Ore. - Researchers in the Pacific Northwest have developed a new, automated technology to analyze the potential for rockfalls from cliffs onto roads and areas below, which should speed and improve this type of risk evaluation, help…

news.title: 22:59 Automated technology developed to analyze rockfall from cliffs: study
news.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, April 13 (Xinhua) -- Researchers in the U.S. Pacific Northwest have developed an automated system to analyze the potential for rockfalls from cliffs onto roads and areas below, hopefully helping save money and lives.

news.title: Technology to improve rockfall analysis on cliffs could save money, lives
news.summary: This LiDAR image of a rock slope on Alaska’s Glenn Highway shows the ‘kinetic energy’ of the slope, with red indicating a higher hazard from rockfalls.

news.title: Scientists use high tech to make roads safer from rockfalls
news.summary: Rockfalls on roadways can be fatal. (Photo: KING) A joint project between three western universities is designed to keep motorists safer from a problem in the mountain west – rockfalls onto highways.

news.title: Protecting roads from rockfalls
news.summary: It's a danger that seems to rain down from the sky. Now University of Washington researchers think they've found a way to better identify risks from falling rocks over highways.
